channel.title: Homes on Sebastian Berndt
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Sebastian Berndt

item.description: Biography Sebastian Berndt is a postdoc in the group of Prof. Dr. Klaus Jansen at the University of Kiel. His research interests revolve around intractable problems, which he tries to solve with approaches such as approximation algorithms or fixed-parameter-tractability. On the other hand, he applies these problems to cryptography and steganography to enable secure communication.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I was the teaching assistant at the following courses at the university of Kiel: WInf-EinfOR: Introduction to Operation Research in the year 2017 (taught by T. Slawig) Inf-ADS: Algorithms and Datastructures in the year 2018 (taught by K. Jansen) I was the teaching assistant at the following courses at the university of Lübeck: CS3000: Algorithm Design in the years 2012 (taught by R. Reischuk), 2013 (taught by R.

(nachfolgend gemeinsam bezeichnet als „Onlineangebot“). Im Hinblick auf die verwendeten Begrifflichkeiten, wie z.B. „Verarbeitung“ oder „Verantwortlicher“ verweisen wir auf die Definitionen im Art. 4 der Datenschutzgrundverordnung (DSGVO).
